title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing othersâ€™ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozillaâ€™s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to COLSA
text: want make bigger change, â€™s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees â€™s needed. â€™ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to COLSA
text: Fork package clone onto computer. havenâ€™t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("CollaborativeInference/COLSA", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesnâ€™t pass cleanly, â€™s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e.Â just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to COLSA
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please donâ€™t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to COLSA
text: Please note COLSA project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Authors and Citation
text: First Last. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Last F (2025). COLSA: Package (One Line, Title Case). R package version 0.0.0.9000, http://gongziyang.com/COLSA/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {COLSA: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {First Last},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {http://gongziyang.com/COLSA/}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: address collaborative inference Cox proportional hazards model distributed data settings, introduce COLSA (Collaborative Likelihood-based Survival Analysis). COLSA uses basis function expansion approximate baseline hazard performs sequential updates efficiently incorporate distributed data batches. Key features COLSA include: Dynamic Basis Expansion: number basis functions adaptively adjusted new data batches arrive, balancing bias variance. Sequential Model Updates: COLSA updates model iteratively incoming batch, using pre-estimated Hessian matrix baseline hazard reduce bias previous batches.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version COLSA like :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: simulation study, considered two continuous two categorical covariates. continuous covariates independently generated bivariate normal distribution. first categorical covariate simulated Bernoulli distribution, second categorical covariate, comprising four levels, drawn multinomial distribution whose probability mass function depended levels first categorical variable. Event times generated mixture Weibull distributions, shape parameters 3 5 scale parameters 10 20, respectively. Censoring times followed exponential distribution rate parameter 3. observed event times subject right censoring. true regression coefficients set ð›ƒ=(0.15,âˆ’0.15,0.3,0.3,0.3,0.3)âŠ¤   \boldsymbol{\beta} = (0.15, -0.15, 0.3, 0.3, 0.3, 0.3)^{\top} total six datasets generated: first three containing 1,500 observations , remaining three containing 500 observations . complete dataset randomly partitioned six groups. COLSA procedure involves: Optimal Basis Selection: Evaluate Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) across range basis function counts select number minimizes AIC. Initial Model Fitting: Fit Cox model first data batch using selected basis functions. Sequential Updating: subsequent batch: () update model parameters new data; (b) adjust number basis functions according rate O(nâˆ’1/5)O(n^{-1/5}), nn cumulative sample size; (c) pre-estimate Hessian baseline hazard mitigate bias estimation. procedure enables scalable communication-efficient survival analysis distributed settings preserving statistical efficiency. model updating process continues sequentially six data batches. Upon incorporating data 6th site, obtain final model fit. summary fitted COLSA model shown : final COLSA estimate obtained, can construct survival curves arbitrary covariate values. diagnostic step, plot estimated baseline cumulative hazard function compare true cumulative hazard function used data-generating process.  comparison demonstrates COLSA method can effectively recover true baseline cumulative hazard function, even distributed censored data settings. shaded region represents 95% confidence interval estimated cumulative hazard function.

what: Calculate the Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) for a 'colsa' object â€” AIC.colsa
title: Calculate the Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) for a 'colsa' object â€” AIC.colsa
text: function computes AIC given 'colsa' object. AIC measure relative quality statistical model given dataset. calculated : \(-2 * logLik + 2 * k\), k number parameters model.

title: Calculate the Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) for a 'colsa' object â€” AIC.colsa

text: object object class "colsa" AIC calculated. ... Additional arguments (currently used).

text: numeric value representing AIC model.

title: Calculate Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) for a 'colsa' Object â€” BIC.colsa
text: function computes Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) fitted 'colsa' model object. BIC model selection criterion balances model fit complexity.

title: Calculate Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) for a 'colsa' Object â€” BIC.colsa
Calculate Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) for a 'colsa' Object â€” BIC.colsa
text: object object class 'colsa'. fitted model BIC calculated. ... Additional arguments (currently used).

title: Calculate Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) for a 'colsa' Object â€” BIC.colsa
text: numeric value representing BIC model.

title: Calculate Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) for a 'colsa' Object â€” BIC.colsa
text: BIC calculated : $$-2 \times \log(\text{Likelihood}) + k \times \log(n)$$ \(k\) number parameters model, \(n\) number samples dataset.

Default 2.0. ... Additional arguments passed optimization function.

title: Collaborative Inference for Cox Proportional Hazards Model in Distributed Data â€” colsa
text: object class "colsa" containing following components: logLik log-likelihood fitted model. theta estimated model parameters. hessian Hessian objective function solution. n_basis number basis functions used. n_features number features model. n_samples number samples dataset. formula formula used fit model. boundary boundary basis functions. scale scaling factor number pre-estimation basis functions. call matched call.

text: function employs trust optimization method estimate model parameters. optimization fails converge, error raised. pre-estimation stage, parameters projected mitigate bias introduced early stage.

what: Compute Integrated Baseline Hazard and Its Derivatives â€” int_basehaz
title: Compute Integrated Baseline Hazard and Its Derivatives â€” int_basehaz
text: function computes integrated baseline hazard derivatives using Gaussian quadrature Bernstein polynomial basis functions.

title: Compute Integrated Baseline Hazard and Its Derivatives â€” int_basehaz
code: int_basehaz(t, deriv, alpha, n_basis, boundary, n_nodes = 10)

title: Compute Integrated Baseline Hazard and Its Derivatives â€” int_basehaz
text: t Numeric. upper limit integration. deriv Integer. Specifies derivative compute: 0: Computes cumulative baseline hazard. 1: Computes gradient cumulative baseline hazard. 2: Computes Hessian cumulative baseline hazard. alpha Numeric vector. Coefficients baseline hazard function. n_basis Integer. number Bernstein polynomial basis functions. boundary Numeric vector length 2. boundary knots Bernstein polynomials. n_nodes Integer. number quadrature nodes use. Default 10.

title: Compute Integrated Baseline Hazard and Its Derivatives â€” int_basehaz
text: Numeric. computed integral derivative.

title: Compute Integrated Baseline Hazard and Its Derivatives â€” int_basehaz
text: function uses Gaussian quadrature approximate integral baseline hazard function, modeled using Bernstein polynomial basis functions. deriv parameter determines whether function computes integral first second derivative.

what: Objective Function for Cox Model Optimization â€” objective
title: Objective Function for Cox Model Optimization â€” objective
text: Computes objective value, gradient, Hessian optimizing Cox proportional hazards model spline-based baseline hazard estimation.

title: Objective Function for Cox Model Optimization â€” objective
code: objective(par, time, status, x, boundary, theta, hessian)

title: Objective Function for Cox Model Optimization â€” objective
text: par Numeric vector parameters optimized, including spline coefficients baseline hazard (alpha) regression coefficients (beta). time Numeric vector observed survival times. status Numeric vector event indicators. x Numeric matrix covariates (features) model. boundary Numeric vector specifying boundary knots splines. theta Numeric vector prior parameters regularization. hessian Numeric matrix prior Hessian regularization.

title: Objective Function for Cox Model Optimization â€” objective
text: list containing: value Scalar value objective function. gradient Numeric vector gradient objective function. hessian Numeric matrix Hessian objective function.

title: Objective Function for Cox Model Optimization â€” objective
text: objective function combines two components: regularization term based prior parameters (theta) prior Hessian (hessian). likelihood-based term Cox proportional hazards model, baseline hazard modeled using Bernstein polynomials. function calculates loss, gradient, Hessian components combines return overall objective value, gradient, Hessian. baseline hazard integrated using helper functions (int_basehaz) compute cumulative hazard derivatives.

title: Proximal Operator (Forward) â€” prox_forward
text: Constructs transformation matrix map coefficients Bernstein polynomial basis functions one dimension another, ensuring consistency properties Bernstein polynomial bases. Note original dimension must less equal target dimension.

title: Proximal Operator (Forward) â€” prox_forward
Proximal Operator (Forward) â€” prox_forward
text: p Integer. number basis functions original dimension. q Integer. number basis functions target dimension.

title: Proximal Operator (Forward) â€” prox_forward
text: matrix representing transformation original dimension target dimension.

title: Proximal Operator (Forward) â€” prox_forward
text: function iteratively constructs transformation matrix expanding basis functions p q, preserving mathematical properties Bernstein polynomials.

what: Simulated Survival Data with Mixed Covariates â€” sim
title: Simulated Survival Data with Mixed Covariates â€” sim
text: dataset generated simulation study evaluate survival models incorporating continuous categorical covariates.

title: Simulated Survival Data with Mixed Covariates â€” sim
Simulated Survival Data with Mixed Covariates â€” sim
text: data frame 6,000 rows 10 variables: id Integer identifier subject. time Observed event censoring time. status Event indicator: 1 event, 0 right-censored. x1 First continuous covariate, generated bivariate normal distribution. x2 Second continuous covariate, also bivariate normal distribution. x31 First binary categorical covariate, generated Bernoulli distribution. x42 Dummy variable level 2 second categorical covariate (reference level 1). x43 Dummy variable level 3 second categorical covariate. x44 Dummy variable level 4 second categorical covariate. group integer (1 6) indicating dataset partition group.

title: Simulated Survival Data with Mixed Covariates â€” sim
text: Simulation study package authors.

title: Simulated Survival Data with Mixed Covariates â€” sim
text: two continuous covariates x1 x2 independently drawn bivariate normal distribution. binary covariate x31 generated Bernoulli distribution. second categorical covariate four levels drawn multinomial distribution, conditional x31. final covariates x42â€“x44 dummy variables representing levels 2â€“4 (level 1 reference). Event times generated mixture two Weibull distributions shape parameters 3 5, scale parameters 10 20, respectively. Right censoring imposed using censoring times drawn exponential distribution rate 3. true regression coefficients : $$\boldsymbol{\beta} = (0.15, -0.15, 0.3, 0.3, 0.3, 0.3)^\top$$ complete dataset includes six subsets: first three contain 1,500 observations , remaining three contain 500 . subsets indicated group variable.

title: Simulated Survival Data with Mixed Covariates â€” sim

what: Update a COLSA Model with New Data â€” update.colsa
title: Update a COLSA Model with New Data â€” update.colsa
text: function updates COLSA model  new data, allowing dynamic adjustment model parameters basis functions.

title: Update a COLSA Model with New Data â€” update.colsa
code: # S3 method for class 'colsa' update(object, newdata, n_basis = "auto", alpha = 1, nu = 0.2, ...)

title: Update a COLSA Model with New Data â€” update.colsa
text: object object class "colsa" representing fitted COLSA model. newdata data.frame containing new data update model. must include variables specified original model formula. n_basis Either numeric value specifying number basis functions "auto" automatically determine number basis functions based sample size scaling parameters. Defaults "auto", means number basis functions determined n_basis = round(alpha * n_samples^nu). alpha positive numeric value controlling growth rate number basis functions n_basis = "auto". Defaults 1.0. nu positive numeric value controlling scaling exponent determining number basis functions n_basis = "auto". Defaults 0.2. ... Additional arguments passed optimization function.

title: Update a COLSA Model with New Data â€” update.colsa
text: updated object class "colsa" following components: logLik: log-likelihood updated model. theta: updated parameter estimates. hessian: updated Hessian matrix. n_samples: updated total number samples. n_basis: vector tracking number basis functions used update step. call: matched call update function.

title: Update a COLSA Model with New Data â€” update.colsa
text: function updates COLSA model incorporating new data adjusting number basis functions dynamically. ensures model parameters Hessian matrix updated accordingly. optimization process performed using trust package maximize log-likelihood updated model.
